verb.description: To retrain (a soldier) in military exercises or the use of arms. Also in extended use, and without object with passive meaning.
To drill a new hole in (a thing); to drill (a hole) again.

origin: Late 18th century; earliest use found in Rules & Regulations for Formations His Majesty s Forces. From re- + drill<br>mid 19th century; earliest use found in The Caledonian Mercury. From re- + drill.
